blog.name: thequeenofhades
blog.title: "...then I wake up, like a thief of dreams."
blog.description: Elizabeth. 33. Writer. We are stardust my darling, we have galaxies in our hearts.

title: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Pancakes
body:
Sansa winced at the sound of a slammed door and some angry steps and then, another door slam, Arya had lost then.

Sansa knew how excited Arya had been for this tournament, because if things had gone well, Arya might have been in a good position for a place in the Olympic fencing team; but judging by Arya’s anger, things had gone south, well, there’s one thing she could do.

Sansa began making Arya’s favorite pancakes, apple pie ones, her sister needed a pick-me-up and if she couldn’t console her properly, at least she could feed her some of her favorite foods; once she had a good stack, she took four of them and went to Arya’s room.

Sansa opened the door quietly, watching her sister’s figure face down on her bed, “Arya, I got you pancakes - your favorites, I’m going to leave them in your night table.”

“My life has fallen to pieces but these pancakes have always been here for me,“ Arya’s voice reached her before she walked out.

"I love you too Arya,” Her voice was soft as she closed the door behind her.

title: 6SS: SanSan: Vampire
body:
“You know, moonlight is the only light I like, the sun burns me,” Sandor’s voice was gruff.

Sansa snorted, “Of course it is, you’re a vampire Sandor; sun would kill you - that’d be sad, I’d miss you.”

“Would you?”

“Of course I would,” Sansa gave him a soft smile, “I love you you silly man, even with all your defects and I would be terribly sad if you die, so don’t.”

Sandor took a hand to his head and scratched it, looking away from Sansa, his good cheek displaying a slight reddish tint, “Ah, I’d miss you too, Little Bird, but love?”

“Yes, love,” Sansa’s voice was firm, “one day you might even love me back.”

blog.name: julibf
blog.title: A Song of Ice and Fire

title: JON AND SANSA MARRIAGE ...............................PART 2
body:
BTW, if you want to read more about Jon and Sansa wedding foreshadowing this meta (X)  by @baelerion its absolutely amazing. After reading this meta, I consider them already married baby ;)

Now that we already presented some of the foreshadowing for the romance and marriage of Jon Snow and Sansa Stark in the books, I want to discuss the NAME that Jon Snow will carry in the end of this story.

I have to be honest and confess that for a long time I just assumed Jon would start a new House, combining House Targaryen and House Stark. But now, I am starting to believe that Jon will actually choose to carry Sansa’s name and pass HER name to all of their children.

First of all @mebongster87  meta, JON WILL BE A STARK, where they observed on season 6, episode 3, the tv show foreshadowing Jon Snow to be the future Lord Stark was a huge hint. I have rewatched the show at least 10 times now, from season 1 to 7 and one thing I know its that they use the change of scenes to foreshadow future events. And they put a lot of detail and attention in the change of scene. 

 

Second of, and I am still amazed how this scene was ignored by the main audience, we had two scenes in season 6 where Jon and Sansa cloak each other with their respective cloaks.

In Westeros, the act of covering someone with their personal cloaks is a great symbol of marriage. According to Game of Thrones Wikipedia, in wedding ceremonies, the girl will meet the groom, covered in her maiden cloak and later, once the marriage is made it official the groom will pass HIS cloak onto the bride, bringing her to his protection but also giving the bride, HIS name.

Well @athimbleful already pointed out here that the show made sure to show us that both Jon and Sansa covered each other with their personal cloaks. 

But for me, even more important than the scene of Jon cloaking Sansa, its the following scene of Sansa being the one covering Jon with HER House cloak. 


(source: weheartit.com /entry/ 241137723)

So, what happened was, Sansa sew with HER OWN HANDS, a Stark cloak and covered Jon Snow with her House sigil and brought HIM to HER protection, so that he could be presented during the rest of season 6 as a real member of the Stark family.

This is the scene that it cant get out of my head. This scene was simply too important. I think this is one of the biggest foreshadows of the show. Sansa Stark making a Stark cloak and passing to Jon Snow, the hero of the story and “she made it like the one her father used to wear”……

 For me this scene not only foreshadows Jon and Sansa marriage, but also Sansa being the one passing her name to Jon, instead of him, passing his Targaryen name to her.

To make this theory even more solid, there is the fact that the last book of the series was supposed to be called “A TIME FOR WOLVES” symbolizing that a new era will start on Westeros by the end of the this tale.

Then, to make things even more visible, we had George RRMartin releasing “Fire and Blood” volume 1, which for me brought a lot of hints that the time of the dragons will come to an end by the end of the A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE.

Our super talented Feuerhexe (fienchen82 on twitter), posted this picture of the on her twitter account and I just remember thinking, oh my God, he cant be serious!


This is “Fire and Blood” summary contents. The “Dying of the Dragons” is followed immediately by the “Hour of the Wolf”.

So, now, not only I am convinced that Jon and Sansa will marry in season 8 and rule Westeros together, I now believe they will do it under the banner of House Stark and this will be the name Jon will pass to his children.

Also, this ending makes more sense considering that Jon Snow always dreamed of being a Stark; Jon didn’t dream to have a family, he wanted to be part of THAT family, the Stark family, not to mention, this also matches Maisie Williams first interview about season 8 where she described:

“It’s either going to be everything that everyone dreamed of or it’s going to be disappointing. It depends what side of the fence you sit on because there’s definitely going to be that divide. It depends what people want from the final season. I love it, but you never know.”


And remember, George told us several times that the answers for how this story ends were always in the first book…..

Jon was not afraid of death, but he did not want to die like that, trussed and bound and beheaded like a common brigand. If he must perish, let it be with a sword in his hand, fighting his father’s killers. He was no true Stark, had never been one … but he could die like one. Let them say that Eddard Stark had fathered four sons, not three.

A Game of Thrones - Jon IX

Jon Snow will be a Stark by the end of this story………………….

 For me this scene not only foreshadows Jon and Sansa marriage, but also Sansa being the one passing her name to Jon, instead of him, passing his Targaryen name to her.

To make this theory even more solid, there is the fact that the last book of the series was supposed to be called “A TIME FOR WOLVES” symbolizing that a new era will start on Westeros by the end of the this tale.

Then, to make things even more visible, we had George RRMartin releasing “Fire and Blood” volume 1, which for me brought a lot of hints that the time of the dragons will come to an end by the end of the A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE.

Our super talented Feuerhexe (fienchen82 on twitter), posted this picture of the on her twitter account and I just remember thinking, oh my God, he cant be serious!


This is “Fire and Blood” summary contents. The “Dying of the Dragons” is followed immediately by the “Hour of the Wolf”.

So, now, not only I am convinced that Jon and Sansa will marry in season 8 and rule Westeros together, I now believe they will do it under the banner of House Stark and this will be the name Jon will pass to his children.

Also, this ending makes more sense considering that Jon Snow always dreamed of being a Stark; Jon didn’t dream to have a family, he wanted to be part of THAT family, the Stark family, not to mention, this also matches Maisie Williams first interview about season 8 where she described:

“It’s either going to be everything that everyone dreamed of or it’s going to be disappointing. It depends what side of the fence you sit on because there’s definitely going to be that divide. It depends what people want from the final season. I love it, but you never know.”


And remember, George told us several times that the answers for how this story ends were always in the first book…..

Jon was not afraid of death, but he did not want to die like that, trussed and bound and beheaded like a common brigand. If he must perish, let it be with a sword in his hand, fighting his father’s killers. He was no true Stark, had never been one … but he could die like one. Let them say that Eddard Stark had fathered four sons, not three.

A Game of Thrones - Jon IX

Jon Snow will be a Stark by the end of this story………………….
trail.content:
BTW, if you want to read more about Jon and Sansa wedding foreshadowing this meta (X)  by @baelerion its absolutely amazing. After reading this meta, I consider them already married baby ;)

Now that we already presented some of the foreshadowing for the romance and marriage of Jon Snow and Sansa Stark in the books, I want to discuss the NAME that Jon Snow will carry in the end of this story.

I have to be honest and confess that for a long time I just assumed Jon would start a new House, combining House Targaryen and House Stark. But now, I am starting to believe that Jon will actually choose to carry Sansa’s name and pass HER name to all of their children.

First of all @mebongster87  meta, JON WILL BE A STARK, where they observed on season 6, episode 3, the tv show foreshadowing Jon Snow to be the future Lord Stark was a huge hint. I have rewatched the show at least 10 times now, from season 1 to 7 and one thing I know its that they use the change of scenes to foreshadow future events. And they put a lot of detail and attention in the change of scene. 

 

Second of, and I am still amazed how this scene was ignored by the main audience, we had two scenes in season 6 where Jon and Sansa cloak each other with their respective cloaks.

In Westeros, the act of covering someone with their personal cloaks is a great symbol of marriage. According to Game of Thrones Wikipedia, in wedding ceremonies, the girl will meet the groom, covered in her maiden cloak and later, once the marriage is made it official the groom will pass HIS cloak onto the bride, bringing her to his protection but also giving the bride, HIS name.

Well @athimbleful already pointed out here that the show made sure to show us that both Jon and Sansa covered each other with their personal cloaks. 

But for me, even more important than the scene of Jon cloaking Sansa, its the following scene of Sansa being the one covering Jon with HER House cloak. 


(source: weheartit.com /entry/ 241137723)

So, what happened was, Sansa sew with HER OWN HANDS, a Stark cloak and covered Jon Snow with her House sigil and brought HIM to HER protection, so that he could be presented during the rest of season 6 as a real member of the Stark family.

This is the scene that it cant get out of my head. This scene was simply too important. I think this is one of the biggest foreshadows of the show. Sansa Stark making a Stark cloak and passing to Jon Snow, the hero of the story and “she made it like the one her father used to wear”……

 For me this scene not only foreshadows Jon and Sansa marriage, but also Sansa being the one passing her name to Jon, instead of him, passing his Targaryen name to her.

To make this theory even more solid, there is the fact that the last book of the series was supposed to be called “A TIME FOR WOLVES” symbolizing that a new era will start on Westeros by the end of the this tale.

Then, to make things even more visible, we had George RRMartin releasing “Fire and Blood” volume 1, which for me brought a lot of hints that the time of the dragons will come to an end by the end of the A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE.

Our super talented Feuerhexe (fienchen82 on twitter), posted this picture of the on her twitter account and I just remember thinking, oh my God, he cant be serious!


This is “Fire and Blood” summary contents. The “Dying of the Dragons” is followed immediately by the “Hour of the Wolf”.

So, now, not only I am convinced that Jon and Sansa will marry in season 8 and rule Westeros together, I now believe they will do it under the banner of House Stark and this will be the name Jon will pass to his children.

Also, this ending makes more sense considering that Jon Snow always dreamed of being a Stark; Jon didn’t dream to have a family, he wanted to be part of THAT family, the Stark family, not to mention, this also matches Maisie Williams first interview about season 8 where she described:

“It’s either going to be everything that everyone dreamed of or it’s going to be disappointing. It depends what side of the fence you sit on because there’s definitely going to be that divide. It depends what people want from the final season. I love it, but you never know.”


And remember, George told us several times that the answers for how this story ends were always in the first book…..

Jon was not afraid of death, but he did not want to die like that, trussed and bound and beheaded like a common brigand. If he must perish, let it be with a sword in his hand, fighting his father’s killers. He was no true Stark, had never been one … but he could die like one. Let them say that Eddard Stark had fathered four sons, not three.

A Game of Thrones - Jon IX

Jon Snow will be a Stark by the end of this story………………….

summary: favourite female characters ⋯◦⟡ SANSA STARK [a song of ice and fire] They are children, Sansa thought. They are silly little...
caption:
favourite female characters ⋯◦⟡ SANSA STARK [a song of ice and fire]

They are children, Sansa thought. They are silly little girls, even Elinor. They’ve never seen a battle, they’ve never seen a man die, they know nothing. Their dreams were full of songs and stories, the way hers had been before Joffrey cut her fathers head off. Sansa pitied them. Sansa envied them.

summary: And best of all, Lord Nestor’s cooks prepared a splendid subtlety, a lemon cake in the shape of the Giant’s Lance, twelve feet...
caption: And best of all, Lord Nestor’s cooks prepared a splendid subtlety, a lemon cake in the shape of the Giant’s Lance, twelve feet tall and adorned with an Eyrie made of sugar. For me, Alayne thought, as they wheeled it out. The cake had required every lemon in the Vale, but Petyr had promised that he would send to Dorne for more.
